New Records: Jake Irvin set a new record with the lowest ERA (1.16) against the Atlanta Braves in a single season for the Washington Nationals.
Key Match Events: Jake Irvin pitched six innings, allowing two hits, one run, and one walk while striking out five.
Pre-Game Insights: Irvin had a 2-0 record and a 1.16 ERA against the Braves before the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Martinez praised Irvin's performance and the team's ability to win against the playoff-contending Braves.
